clinical_study.official_title: Connectome Characterization With Aging Using Functional and Structural MRI

brief_summary.textblock: The main aim of this project is to develop a new model to characterize brain connectivity and its changes with aging. This characterization will be based on new sensitive and specific markers, allowing a better understanding of structural and functional brain networks. To this end, two complementary MRI methods will be developed: 1) Resting-state functional MRI (rs-fMRI) which allows the measurement of cerebral activity in different cortical gray matter regions, and 2) high angular resolution diffusion imaging (HARDI) MRI, which allows to characterize brain tissue microarchitecture. HARDI sequences will be developed to acquire and reconstruct fiber tractography of patient's brains. In combination with conventional MRI, both HARDI and rs-fMRI will be used to estimate the connection degree between each pair of cortical regions, so- called "Connectome". Once generated, brain networks will be quantified through numerous graph metrics, such as graph density, global efficiency and assortativity (etc.), reflecting the organization and topology of subjects' connectivity with aging.

primary_outcome.measure: Functional and structural connectivity MRI marker : resting-state fMRI
primary_outcome.description: Functional connectivity of grey matter (GM) using resting-state fMRI

primary_outcome.measure: Functional and structural connectivity MRI marker : Functional connectivity
primary_outcome.description: Graph-theory methods analysis of functional connectivity of grey matter

primary_outcome.measure: Functional and structural connectivity MRI marker : Diffusion tensor
primary_outcome.description: Structural connectivity of white matter (WM) fiber bundles measured by diffusion tensor imaging

primary_outcome.measure: Functional and structural connectivity MRI marker : Structural connectivity
primary_outcome.description: Graph-theory methods analysis of Structural connectivity of white matter (WM) fiber

primary_outcome.measure: Functional and structural connectivity MRI marker : SPM software
primary_outcome.description: Cortical and subcortical grey matter (GM) volumes using the SPM software

secondary_outcome.description: Calculation of functional connectivity metrics using graphs theory methods

arm_group.description: 40 subjects will benefit from a full MRI
10 subjects will benefit from the realization of 3 MRI. An MRI examination performed at the time of inclusion and then an examination, at 3 months and at 9 months (ie 3 examinations per subject).

intervention.description: MRI examination will comprise conventional T1 and FLAIR sequences, and advanced sequences such as rs-fMRI and High angular resolution MRI (HARDI).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Volunteers (Men and women) aged between 18 and 50 years
- No neurological or psychiatric diseases
Exclusion Criteria:
- MRI contraindications
- Pregnant women or nursing women
- Persons under guardianship or any other administrative or deprivation of liberty or of right
